snippet: A Nigerian airliner that crashed in Lagos, killing all 153 on board, was American-built, so the United States will be part of the investigation.
abstract: Rescue workers seek to recover corpses and extinguish fires from a crowded neighborhood in Lagos, Nigeria, where an airliner crashed; the pilot of the plane had reported engine trouble just before it fell from the sky, killing all 153 on board and an unknown number of people on the ground.

byline.original: By ADAM NOSSITER and MATTHEW L. WALD
byline.contributor: Adam Nossiter reported from Bamako, and Matthew L. Wald from Washington. Ben Ezeamalu contributed reporting from Lagos, Nigeria.

lead_paragraph: A Nigerian airliner that crashed in Lagos, killing all 153 on board, was American-built, so the United States will be part of the investigation.

headline.sub: Engine Trouble Reported in Nigerian Crash
headline.main: Engine Trouble Was Reported Before Nigerian Crash
headline.print_headline: Engine Trouble Was Reported Before Nigerian Crash
